title: Biocontainment unit topic of next Omaha Science Café
text:
OMAHA, Neb. (AP) - The biocontainment unit that was used to treat several people with the Ebola virus in 2014 will be the focus of the next Omaha Science Cafe.

The speaker will be Morgan Scrader. She is the clinincal coordinator for the biocontainment unit at Nebraska Medicine. She is also an educator with the National Ebola Treatment and Education Center and has coordinated drills and training for unit staff.

The event is scheduled to begin at 7 p.m. on Tuesday at the Slowdown, 729 N. 14th St.

Science Cafés involve face-to-face conversations with scientists about current science topics.
